RAM model of computation: We usually assume a single processor computer with infinite RAM

Inaccuracies: Some operations take longer than others
Compiler optimisation can speed things up

O-notation.Definition: Ignores the differences between multiplication of powers (i.e. 2n^5 is the same as 3n^5)
O-notation.Dominating term: The term in an equation which determines the approximate value (i.e. in n^2 + n^3 the n^3 is the dominating term)
O-notation.Upper bound: The maximum time an algorithm might take. Denoted by O(g(dominant term))
O-notation.Lower bound: The minimum time an algorithm might take. Denoted by Ω(g(dominant term))
O-notation.Tight bound: Both the minimum time and maximum time an algorithm might take (notated by Θ(g(dominant term)))

Heuristic: Tries to find a good result to a problem but (unlike an algorithm) it does not guarantee the best solution
